outputs.output_descr: HIV and human rights: Stigma and discrimination against people of high right risk of infection and people living with HIV is widespread in the region. Even in the absence of criminalization, other legal provisions often violate the rights of men who have sex with men, transgender persons and sex workers, as do arbitrary and inappropriate enforcement, which obstruct essential service delivery. HIV and sexual diversity: The HIV prevalence rates among men who have sex with men and transgender persons account for a significant percentage of new infection across the Asia Pacific Region. outputs.output_descr: Socioeconomic  determinants and MDGs: In partnership with the Poverty Practice, we propose to integrate HIV into the MDG Acceleration Framework. At present the two MAF countries are PNG and Lao PDR and we would support the COs, along with the Poverty Team. HIV-sensitive  social protection: The socio-economic impact of HIV on households of people living with HIV is severe as indicated by national level studies by UNDP. However, impact mitigation, particularly HIV-sensitive social protection, is yet to be acknowledged as a priority in the national AIDS strategies. There is considerable emphasis on social protection within UNDP and the Regional Team proposes to follow up the socio-economic impact studies with policy advocacy and country support on social protection, in partnership with the poverty team. The initiatives will be undertaken in partnership with other relevant UN agencies, governments and partners.

Strengthening the governance component of AIDS responses. Coordination and accountability: Continued capacity and technical support will be provided to national AIDS bodies through CO strengthening of responses as well as national coordination. For South-South learning, good practice documentation on national coordination will be undertaken in partnership with the NY team. CSO partnerships: Through regional platforms, Joint UN initiatives, CSOs and CBOs, efforts will continue to strengthen CSO-Government partnership to strengthen participation, transparency, leadership and efficiency; particularly for MARPs. Local HIV responses: Strengthening decentralisation of HIV responses wherever epidemiologically relevant has been a priority for the regional team and initiatives have been undertaken in PNG, Indonesia and Philippines. Capacity support and policy guidance will be provided to the national, provincial and district AIDS establishments in strengthening the local responses. Additionally, steps will be undertaken to strengthen municipal responses to MSM and HIV in six cities, building the work of 2010.
